african.text: In the south they don’t care how close you get, as long as you don’t get too high. In the north, they don’t care how high you get, as long as you don’t get too close.
During a storm you do not take shelter under just one roofing tile.
When the bait is more than the fish, 'tis time to stop fishing.
Rooster makes mo' racket dan de hen w'at lay de aig.
Talkin' 'bout fire doesn't boil the pot.
Tell me whom you love, and I'll tell you who you are.
The blacker the berry the sweeter the juice.
The rainbow might be better lookin' if 'twasn't such a cheap show.
The squirrel can beat the rabbit climbing a tree, but then the rabbit makes the best stew that sort of equalizes the thing.
The very time I thought I was lost, my dungeon shook and my chains fell off.
The worm don't see nothing pretty in the robin's song.
Wagon makes the loudest noise when it's goin' out empty.
We ain't what we want to be; we ain't what we gonna be; but thank God, we ain't what we was.
Ain't no use askin' the cow to pour you a glass of milk.
All poor people ain't black/ and all black people ain't poor.
Death don't see no difference 'tween the big house and the cabin.
Dog don't get mad when you say he's a dog.
Flies can't fall in a tight-closed pot.
Hand plow can't make furrows by itself.
Heaps of good cotton stocks get chopped up from association with the weeds.
I'm not going to lend you a stick to break my head with.
If you ask a Negro where he's been, he'll tell you where he's going.
If you want to keep something secret from black folks, put it between the covers of a book.
In the South they don't care how close you get, as long as you don't get too high. In the North, they don't care how high you get, as long as you don't get too close.
It takes a heap of licks to drive a nail in the dark.
It takes a heap of licks to strike a nail in the dark.
Jaybird don't rob his own nest.
Mothers raise their daughters and let their sons grow up.
Nothing can suffice a person except that which they have not.
Occasionally a man with a right smart education can't find his knife when it gets in the wrong pocket.
A cat in its castle has a lion's teeth.
A cat keeps its crawls inside until it meets a mouse.
A cat may go to a monastery, but she still remains a cat.
A centipede is not crippled by the loss of one limb.
A chameleon can only change its colour but never change its skin.
A chick that will grow into a cock can be spotted the very day it hatches.
A chicken with beautiful plumage does not sit in a corner.
A chief in the village never sees the devil.
A chief may have more wives than he can remember but you dare not try to share his wives with him.
A chief should not create a new law when he is angry.
A blacksmith has no need of an axe.
A blind person knows his environment more than a visitor with eyes.
A bottle that believes it's cracked to smile it will end up on the dustbin.
A bowl should not laugh when a calabash breaks.
A boy may cry; but a man as to conceal his pain.
A bush that doesn't rotate baskets must not grow mushrooms.
A butterfly thinks itself a bird because it can fly.
A camel cannot see the crookedness of its neck.
A camel never sees its own hump.
A canoe peddler doesn't tell the crocodile he has along snout until he's crossed the river.
A beautiful one hurts the heart.
A beggar won't mind being insulted.
A beggar's knees are supple.
A big fish is caught with big bait.
A bird doesn't alert his fellow bird that a stone is coming.
A bird doesn't forget one who killed off his feathers during the rain season.
A bird may fly off the earth and land on an anthill, but it will still be on the ground.
A bird that flies off the earth and lands on an anthill is still on the ground.
A bird that prays for rain will find its self soaked.
A bird with fire on its tail burns its own nest.
A child among elders converses with its ears.
A child can play with its mother's breasts, but not its father's testicles.
A child doesn't belong to the father or mother; a child belongs to the ancestors.
A child doesn't breast-feed from a stepmother if its mother is still alive.
A child while bathing only scrubs its stomach.
A child who eats too much shouldn't blame is buttock.
A child who is fearless is going to bring tears to his mother's eyes.
A child who knows how to wash his hands will eat with the chiefs.
A child who protested when being stripped on the back by its mother, it's humbled by the scorching sun when left to walk.
A child's fingers are not scalded by a piece of hot yam which his mother puts into his palm.
A child's hand is not burned by hot yam which is placed into his palm by his mother.
A clean conscience makes a soft pillow.
A clear conscience fears no accusation.
A cloudy sky doesn't always cry rain.
A cock says it's because of the situation it is faced with that it has its knees in the opposite direction.
A comb becomes bad when it hurts you.
A corn swallowed by a fowl will never germinate in its belly.
A corpse doesn't have time to cover its pubic region.
A cow must graze where she is tied.
A cow without a tail should not try to chase away flies.
"Come and I'll tell you something," tickles the ear.
"What's all the fuss?" said the crane after the eel had slipped away. "I never liked fish anyway."
A baby on its mother's back doesn't know the journey is long.
A bachelor should always spend minimum time with a friend's wife.
A bachelor's wife doesn't have ears.
A bad cook also has his/her share of the bad food.
A bad habit is like fire you can't play with it and expect not to get burnt.
A bad wound deserves strong medicine.
A barber does not shave himself.
A barren woman is like a leaking pot.
A guest sees more in an hour than a host in a year.
A guest who breaks the dishes of his host is not soon forgotten.
A hammer does not work with iron.
A happy man marries the girl he loves, but a happier man loves the girl he marries.
A hen's curses have never killed the eagle.
A herdsman must yell to enter the fence.
A home without a woman is like a barn without a yam.
A horse may take the warrior to the battlefield but can never fight.
A house is for a voyage but a tomb is for eternity.
A hungry calf cannot frisk happily over another with a full stomach.
A coward always hides behind someone else after he has thrown a stone.
A cowardly hyena lives longer.
A crime eats its own child.
A cutting word is worse than a bowstring, a cut may heal, but the cut of the tongue does not.
A day of hunger is not starvation.
A day you believe is not bad, is the one that becomes bad.
A dead body cannot urge over how it should be placed in the grave.
A dead cock never crows.
A debt may get moldy, but it never decays.
A debt may get mouldy but it never decays.
A wise will is dedicated to the ancestors for its them who gave you everything'
A woman is like a banana; one alone can turn the whole bunch rotten.
A woman is like a bee treat her well and she will make honey, treat her badly and she will go wild.
A woman is never old when it comes to the dance she knows.
A woman listens only to the advice of a fool.
A woman wearing trousers? What has she got hanging in there?
A woman who delivers a baby in the market square has nothing to hide.
A woman who pursues a man for sex looses her spiritual beauty.
A woman who runs holding her breast has got nothing pursuing her.
A woman who wants a child doesn't sleep in her clothes.
Every frog is a gazelle in the eyes of its mother.
Every head must do its own thinking.
Every hill has its leopard.
Every misfortune is a blessing.
Every old man was once a young man but not every young man will become an old man.
Every time an old man dies it is as if a library has burnt down.
Every time you have something good there is someone who wants you to throw it so as they can pick it.
Everybody has been young before, but not everybody has been old before.
Everyone has a right to be stupid some just abuse the right.
Everything has a pattern and a partner.
Heaven and earth shall never meet.
Help me during the flood, and I will help you during the drought.
Him with a bold head knows how to protect it through thorns.
Him with a bushy field cannot harvest edibles from it.
Him with a clean future has a clean past.
Him with is own knowledge know how to eat from it.
Hold a true friend with both hands.
Honest advice doesn't destroy true friendship.
Hooting all right and sleeping all day, doesn't make an owl wise.
Hope is a good thing and good things never die.
He who asks questions, cannot avoid the answers.
He who asks you to converse ends up telling others that you're shouting.
He who banishes you is the one who shows you the way.
He who betrays you is not one from far away.
He who brings firewood infected with maggots in his house should not complain when lizards start visiting him.
He who burns down his house knows why ashes cost a fortune.
He who came to work never sleeps.
He who cannot rest, cannot work; he who cannot let go, cannot hold on; he who cannot find footing, cannot go forward.
He who chews two bones at the same time will surely bite his tongue.
He who crosses a bridge to paradise and blows it after him is going to hell.
A fool and water will go the way they are diverted.
A fool looks for dung where the cow never browsed.
A fool may chance to put something into a wise man's head.
A foolish head weakens the feet.
A foot must never quarrel with the ground.
A foreign cock can never crow in a foreign country.
A forest cannot be cut with a broken axe.
A friend is one who knows every thing about you and still wants to be your friend.
A friend to everybody is a friend to nobody.
A friend who fawns is better than an enemy who smiles.
A roaring lion kills no game.
A rock in the middle of the sea is never afraid of the rain.
A ruined people are as miserable as a dog in the house of death.
A satisfied man doesn't understand the feeling of a hungry man.
A scared dog barks to pretend to its master but a brave dog bits to protect him.
A second wife cannot celebrate the beating of the first wife because that same beating awaits her when the third wife arrives.
A secret remains a secret only when one person knows it.
A severely under paid hungry teacher in a renovated, well-equipped classroom, can perform just as well as a bird without feathers can do in a hanging, decorated cage.
A short man is not a boy.
A short person touches where he can reach.
A rat with many offspring always sleeps with his door open.
A razor may be sharper than an ax, but it cannot cut wood.
A real family eats the same cornmeal.
A reflection does not see itself.
A regular fighter who discords peace is bound to be fought by his own anger.
A restless grasshopper eventually ends up in a birds teeth.
A ripe melon falls by itself.
A river doesn't flow through the forest without felling the trees.
A river doesn't run straight because there was nobody to advise it.
A river that forgets its source will soon dry out.
Happiness is not perfected until it is shared.
Happiness often sneaks through your door when you left the door open.
Happy is a man who goes hunting for rats and catches an elephant.
Haste and hurry can only bear children with many regrets.
Haste bequeaths disappointment.
Haste makes waste.
Having a goal is just a dream with a deadline.
Having a good discussion is like having riches.
Having beauty doesn't mean understanding the perseverance of marriage.
Having little knowledge is like having your hands tied around your neck like a slave.
As long as the white man stutters, the interpreters have a lot of work.
As soon as you question someone's integrity, it is a reflection of your own.
As the dog said, "If I fall down for you and you fall down for me, it is playing."
As the dog said, 'If I fall down for you and you fall down for me, it is playing.'
As the wound inflames the finger, so thought inflames the mind.
As you do for your ancestors, your children will do for you.
Ashes fly back into the face of him who throws them.
Ashes will always blow back into the face of the thrower.
At a hunting expedition you cannot apportion the meat before you kill the animal.
At that particular time a mad person gives you something take it immediately before he changes is mind.
Death is like a dress that, at some point or another, everyone has to wear.
Death is like a robe everyone has to wear.
Debt is slavery.
Declare kinship with the hyena, and all hyenas are your friend.
Defeat is not failure but trail is total failure.
Defiance is the biggest weapon of the weak.
Despise not a snail for its slow and struggling movement; it has a destination and with time it shall arrive.
Despite the beauty of the moon, sun and the stars, the sky also has a threatening thunder and striking lightening.
Differences between husband and wife should not be aired in the marketplace.
Do not call the forest that shelters you a jungle.
How come that when I lost my sheep and could not find it, I was questioned; but the hyena who was found with the sheepskin is not questioned.
How ever big a rat is, it can't threaten a cat.
However hot the sun, it will never dry the sea.
However long the dry season takes a seasonal river will never forget where it used to pass.
However long the night, the dawn will break.
However loud an ant shouts from the ground, no one will hear it.
Human blood is heavy; he who has shed it cannot run away.
Hunger is felt by a slave, and hunger is felt by a king.
Hunger makes the big fish come out of hiding in the great river.
Hunt in every jungle, for there is wisdom and good hunting in all of them.
Anger against a brother is felt in the flesh, not in the bone.
Anxiety will not let you die of hunger.
Any dead fish can flow down the river but it takes a live one to swim back up stream.
Any weapon is dangerous even to a person handling it.
Anyone can be polite to a king, but it takes a gentleman to be polite to a beggar.
Anyone suffering from a running stomach is never afraid of the dark.
Anyone who has sold an old lady, knows the price of an old man.
Anything with a beginning also has an end.
As long as a cock lives, it is said to have belonged to the child of the house; but when it is slaughtered for super, it is then that the real owner emerges.
As long as I make you to be inferior, I render myself inferior.
Authority is in generosity.
Avarice is the root of all evil.
Bad friends will prevent you from having good friends.
Bad luck for one man is good luck for another.
Bad officials are elected by poor citizens who do not vote.
Banish a strong man, banish a strong man but when there is war you will look for the strong man.
Be aware of a man with a sweet tongue he can lead you to buying bad meat.
Be careful of the words you say each day, make sure each is nice and sweet, because may be in the days ahead, there will be some you'll have to eat.
Be careful of what you own because what you own might eventually own you.
Be careful when you are sharing a calabash of porridge with a toothless man.
He is a fool who praises the fruit of a tree and forgets its roots.
He is a wise man who has no worries about the things he doesn't have but he rejoices for those things that he has.
He on whose head we would break a coconut never stands still.
He ought to be feared who sends you with a message, not the one to whom you are sent.
He that beats the drum for the mad man to dance is no better than the mad man himself.
He that dines with the gods must do so with a very long spoon.
He that fights for a ne'er-do-well has nothing to show for it except a head covered in earth and grime.
He that fought the lion must surely have the lion's claws in his body.
He who angers you controls you.
He who asks for the meaning of a proverb has called her/his mother's dowry a waste.
A genius is he who is first to be right'.
A gentle politician doesn't promise to build bridges where there is no water.
A genuine gift is like water when it flows out it can never return.
A girl's patience can only be recognised by how long she keeps her virginity.
A goat does not always graze in the same place.
A good beginning is a halfway a battle won.
A good day shows itself early in the morning.
A good deed is something one returns.
A good devil is as equal as to a bad god.
A good leader was once a good follower.
Ears that do not listen to advice, accompany the head when it is chopped off.
Earth is the queen of beds.
Eating a lot does not satisfy greediness.
Eating is kinship.
Eating tough meat is always harder for a toothless lion.
Eating what you plant is better than begging for leftovers.
Enjoy breakfast all alone, share lunch with your best friend and give dinner to your enemy.
Even a close friend cannot rescue one from old age.
Even a healer's lies are a big relief to a sick person.
Even a horn can be stopped from fighting and made to sing forever.
Do not speak badly of a crocodile when your leg is in the river.
Do not speak of a rhinoceros if there is no tree nearby.
Do not step on the dog's tail, and he will not bite you.
Do not tell the man carrying you that he stinks.
Do not tell the man who is carrying you that he stinks.
Do not throw away the oars before the boat reaches the shore.
Do not try to fight a lion if you are not one yourself.
Do not walk behind us, we may not lead; do not walk in front of us, we may not follow; walk besides us, so that we may guide each other.
Do something at its right time, and peace will accompany it.
Don't admire the flying bird before you know the pain of flapping.
A lizard without one leg cannot move up a tree.
A long lasting visitor grinds the wine.
A long-tailed animal doesn't jump over fire.
A mad dog bites anything except itself.
A man accused of stealing a goat should not entertain his visitors with goats meat.
A man and a goat can be friends but it would be foolishness for the goat to pay the first visit.
A man can't challenge his spirit in a wrestling match.
A man does not run among thorns for no reason; either he is chasing a snake or a snake is chasing him.
A man doesn't escape from bees with a lump of honey in his hand.
A man doesn't know when he kills.
A good man gone wrong is usually a bad man found out.
A good man never stays in the grave forever, he always has chance to come back.
A good name is better than wealth.
A good plan today is better than a perfect plan tomorrow.
A good reputation is something you must pay for, but you can never buy.
A good smile shows how happy the soul is.
A grasshopper that sleeps about will be soon awake in a lizard's mouth.
A gravestone cannot be used for grinding.
A green grass in the green snake.
A guard dog cannot watch two homes at once.
A picture is worth a thousand words.
A poor person has no struggles.
A potter eats from a broken piece of his pots.
A pregnant woman cannot claim to be a virgin.
A pretty basket does not prevent worries.
A proud heart can survive a general failure because such a failure does not prick its pride.
A puppy must not confront a large animal.
A raindrop does not spare the head of the notable.
A rat never goes near a cat's celebration venue.
A rat stinks, but it has its own home.
A dog that belongs to every one will die of hunger.
A dog will defend its territory though it's friendly.
A dog will not follow its owner to follow a king.
A dog you don't feed will never heed your call.
A donkey's husband can protect it from a hyena.
A drowning man will clutch at a straw.
A drunkard is like a whisky bottle only neck and belly but no head.
A fallen branch cannot bear fruits on its own.
A false friend is like a shadow their only with you when the sun is shining.
A family is like a thick forest, often from outside its dense, when your inside each tree has its own position.
A king who doesn't tolerate comments about his mouth shouldn't eat in public.
A kinsman in trouble has to be saved, not blamed.
A knife does not recognize its owner.
A kola nut is small, but it is more important that it goes round to each person and not that it fills the stomach.
A lamb takes after its mother.
A lazy chick that exposes itself will be a delicious meal for the eagle.
A lazy fly cannot have a taste of a fresh wound.
A lazy man plants on a mad bark as an excuse for not planting.
A lazy man will remember he has not planted when is neighbour is harvesting.
A lazy man's farm is the breeding ground for snakes.
A short rope ties nothing.
A sick way between two people can only be cared for if the two of them die.
A silly daughter teaches her mother how to bear children.
A sin against a brother or sister is an offence against the gods.
A single slip may cause lasting injury.
A slave must be humble.
A sleeping head needs more than its neck to support it.
A small axe is not sufficient to cut down a large tree.
A small house will hold a hundred friends.
A small shrub may grow into a tree.
A determined hunter is never frightened in the jungle.
A diamond doesn't lose its value due to lack of admiration.
A difficult journey will make you daring and harden your will.
A dirty stick makes everyone who touches it dirty.
A dog cannot eat a bone tied to a snake.
A dog does not mind being called a dog.
A dog gives birth to a dog.
A dog knows its master but not its master's master.
A dog never forgets his master.
A dog returns to where he has been fed.
A family tie is like a tree, it can bend but it cannot break.
A father never resembles his son, it's the son that resembles the father.
A father voodoos with his son and a mother voodoos with her daughter.
A fatherless boy is no better than unburied seed.
A feather is just a delicate thing when removed from a bird because it carries the bird everywhere in the world.
A fish and bird may fall in love but the two cannot build a home together.
A fish will not live out of water but will prefer air to hot water.
A fly that dances carelessly in front of a spider's web, risks the wrath of the spider's teeth.
A fly that falls on your wound is more important.
A fool and his money is one big party.
Don't laugh at the nakedness of our ancestors because before their eyes we're all naked for our spirits belong to them.
Don't let a fool kiss you no let a kiss fool you.
Don't let your past dictate your future.
Don't look at the visitor's face but at his stomach.
Don't look into the eyes of your lover, or you will see what he has told many women before.
Don't loose hope no situation is permanent.
Don't make a goat your friend if your skirt is made of plantation leaves, or else it will strip you naked.
Don't meddle with a family feud.
Don't move an ancient boundary stone or encroach on the fields of the fatherless.
Don't question a blind man for buying a mirror, it must serve him some purpose.
A woman's polite devotion is her greatest beauty.
A woman's stomach does not grow if she is not pregnant.
A woman's strength is a multitude of words.
A word to the wise is enough.
A word written stays forever than hundred spoken work.
A worm cannot kill a fly.
A wound given by a word is many times harder to cure than that which is given by the sword.
A wound inflicted by a friend does not heal.
After a foolish deed comes remorse.
After the evil cross the crown has come.
A leader does not rise for a squirrel.
A leader is he who tells his people what they must hear, not what they want to hear.
A leopard is chasing us, and you are asking me, "Is it a male or a female?"
A leopard is such an elusive animal that it can only be caught by the combined force of a man and his father-in-law.
A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is still putting on its shoes.
A lie has many variations, the truth none.
A little rain each day will fill the rivers to overflowing.
A little subtleness is better than a lot of force.
A lizard can't be a snake even without its limbs.
A lizard longs to sit down but its tail doesn't let it.
A weapon that you don't have in your hand will not kill a snake. Looking for something can get in the way of finding it.
A weapon which you don't have in your hand won't kill a snake.
A weird child at times brings sweet fruits at home.
A whisper has more meaning than a noisy talk.
A white tooth has a bloody root.
A wind can move the branches of trees but it will never move the head of a man.
A wise man never knows all, only fools know everything.
A wise man who knows proverbs, reconciles difficulties.
A wise person must know the language, sayings, and tales of his society.
A wise saying goes without say.
A man should live to prove himself worth of his own flesh and blood.
A man should not be too happy in the morning.
A man should not, out of pride and etiquette, swallow his phlegm.
A man who after his dying speech doesn't die, bears the same guilt.
A man who cries all the time is not heard.
A man who dictates separates himself from others.
A man who does no hard work will never know the value of rest.
A man who doesn't know how to play sex disappears after the first time.
A man who hides a thorn in his foot earns a swelling.
A man who is patient is rewarded.
Good resolutions are like babies crying in church, they should be carried out immediately.
Good things are hot.
Good things sell themselves; those that are bad have to be advertised.
Gossiping about the enemy can result in a war.
Grass doesn't grow on a bushy road.
Great events may stem from words of no importance.
Great men think alike.
Greatness is not achieved with violence.
Greed loses what it has gained..
Happiness is like a perfume, you cannot pour it all on others without allowing a few drops to fall on yourself.
After the storm the sun comes out.
All great truths begins as blasphemies.
All is well that ends well.
All plants are our brothers and sisters and they talk to us and if we listen we can hear them.
All things happen when their times come.
All war follow a demonstrate failure of difficulty diplomacy.
Almost everyone is mad but some people can control there madness.
Always stamp your hunting nets where the animal is going to pass.
An animal that gives birth to a young one in the desert must suckle it in the desert.
An army of sheep led by a lion would defeat an army of lions led by a sheep.
He who feels it, knows it.
He who forgets his past is lost.
He who gets annoyed of darkness ends up knocking himself everywhere.
He who guards his lips, guards his life.
He who has brothers has more than riches can buy.
He who has given up doesn't blame the one moving on.
He who has got experience can milk a running cow.
He who has no pond must not breed crocodiles.
He who has not traveled widely thinks that his mother is the best cook.
He who has people is richer than he who has money.
If you chase two rabbits you will catch none.
If you choose to lie down with dogs, you must be prepared to wake up with fleas.
If you choose to make friendship with a pig you must be prepared to live in the mad.
If you climb up a tree, you must climb down the same tree.
If you close your eyes because of the bad people around you, you will not see the good people passing by.
If you close your eyes to facts, you will learn through accidents.
If you cry and receive someone to help you cry more then you cry more.
If you cry because you miss the sun, your tears will not let you see the moon.
If you cure a monkey of its tooth ache its your maize farm that suffers.
If you damage the character of another, you damage your own.
If we do what we always did we will always remain what we always we're.
If wisdom is measured by the size of the beard then the goat is a philosopher king.
If you are building something and a nail breaks, should you stop building altogether, or should you change the nail?
If you are digging a pit for your enemy, don't make it too deep, for you may fall into it.
If you are not an animal you will never find yourself in a trap.
If you are threatened by a man, sleep at night, if it is by a woman then stay awake.
If you are too modest, then you will go hungry.
If you are too smart to pay the doctor, you had better be too smart to get ill.
If you aren't in your own home, you dance while seated.
If you befriend a mosquito it will still attack you at night.
If you know his father and grandfather, don't worry about his son.
If you know the beginning well, the end will not trouble you.
If you lie the ancestors will punish you.
If you live by the river you can hear the crab cough.
If you live in a glasshouse you should not throw stones.
If you man is a wizard, you must become a witch.
If you need ears go and borrow them from the elephant.
If you observe attentively you will even find wisdom in shadows.
If you offer to share your seat with a person who has a big bottom your bound to lose it completely.
If you pay homage to the man on top, others will pay homage to you when it's your turn to be on top.
It is not the lamb that should go and ask the lion if it has had dinner.
It is not the things in the soup that I am afraid of but perhaps the person I am eating with.
It is not what you are called, but what you answer to.
It is not with saying, "Honey," "Honey," that sweetness will come into the mouth.
It is not work that kills, but worry.
It is not worth telling a lovely story at the funeral.
It is odd for a dog to look unconcerned when a sheep is barking at a stranger.
It is only a mad dog that barks at a flying bird.
It is only a stupid cow that rejoices at the prospect of being taken to a beautiful abattoir.
It is only the eagle that can give an account of the whisper of the cloud.
In the great river there are large and small fish.
Indecision is like a stepchild: if he does not wash his hands, he is called dirty, if he does, he is wasting water.
Innocence can be an offence.
Instead of being near a pagan you rather be near an animal.
It costs you your good spirit to steal than buying or seeking.
It doesn't matter how slowly you walk, just as long as you don't stop.
It is a foolish fly that is buried with a corpse.
It is a man with a harp who should decide how he is going to sleep.
It is a person suffering from cold who will first think of closing the door.
It is a stupid dog that barks at an elephant.
If you tell people to live together, you tell them to quarrel.
If you think education is expensive try ignorance.
If you think you are too small to make a difference, try sleeping in a closed room with a mosquito.
If you think you're too small to be noticed go and sleep in a room which is full of mosquitoes.
If you tie a frog on the leg a snake will follow you.
If you travel with lies you will reach your destination but you might be unable to retrace your steps.
If you value piece and freedom you will loose it.
